intro: Koeleria enodis, commonly known as the slender wheatgrass, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its fine, grass-like leaves and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as fields and roadsides. It produces small, pale blue to white flowers that bloom in the summer months. Koeleria enodis is often used in restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and its adaptability to various environmental conditions.
